org.androidannotations.api

Interface BackgroundExecutor.WrongThreadListener

  • Enclosing class:
    BackgroundExecutor

    public static interface BackgroundExecutor.WrongThreadListener
    A callback interface to be notified when a method invocation is expected from another thread.
    See Also:
    BackgroundExecutor.setWrongThreadListener(WrongThreadListener), BackgroundExecutor.checkUiThread(), BackgroundExecutor.checkBgThread(String...), SupposeUiThread, SupposeBackground

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onBgExpected(java.lang.String... expectedSerials)
      Will be called, if the method is supposed to be called from a background thread, but was called from the UI-thread.
      void onUiExpected()
      Will be called, if the method is supposed to be called from the UI-thread, but was called from a background thread.
      void onWrongBgSerial(java.lang.String currentSerial, java.lang.String... expectedSerials)
      Will be called, if the method is supposed to be called from a background thread with one of expectedSerials, but was called from a currentSerial.

    • Method Detail

      • onUiExpected

        void onUiExpected()
        Will be called, if the method is supposed to be called from the UI-thread, but was called from a background thread.
        See Also:
        SupposeUiThread, BackgroundExecutor.setWrongThreadListener(WrongThreadListener), BackgroundExecutor.DEFAULT_WRONG_THREAD_LISTENER

      • onBgExpected

        void onBgExpected(java.lang.String... expectedSerials)
        Will be called, if the method is supposed to be called from a background thread, but was called from the UI-thread.
        Parameters:
        expectedSerials - a list of allowed serials. If any background thread is allowed the list will be empty.
        See Also:
        SupposeBackground, BackgroundExecutor.setWrongThreadListener(WrongThreadListener), BackgroundExecutor.DEFAULT_WRONG_THREAD_LISTENER

      • onWrongBgSerial

        void onWrongBgSerial(java.lang.String currentSerial,
                   java.lang.String... expectedSerials)
        Will be called, if the method is supposed to be called from a background thread with one of expectedSerials, but was called from a currentSerial. currentSerial will be null, if it is called from a background thread without a serial.
        Parameters:
        currentSerial - the serial of caller thread or null if there is no serial
        expectedSerials - a list of allowed serials
        See Also:
        SupposeBackground, BackgroundExecutor.setWrongThreadListener(WrongThreadListener), BackgroundExecutor.DEFAULT_WRONG_THREAD_LISTENER
